implementations

Class CalendarImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • implementations.CalendarImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Calendar

    public class CalendarImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements Calendar
    This class implements a Calendar using a SharkKB to store and receive Appointments from and a SyncKP to transfer Appointments and Comments to other instances. Please not that the SharkKB files that are stored on the file system (directory specified in the constructor) should not be used by other Applications using shark-fw to avoid conflicts.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int CONNECTION_TIMEOUT
      the connection timeout used by SharkEngine
      static java.lang.String TYPE_KEY
      the name of the property used to identify Appointments and Comments

      This constructor sets up a new Calendar by initializing the used SharkKB, SharkEngine and SyncKP.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CalendarImpl

        public CalendarImpl(java.lang.String username,
                    java.lang.String email,
                    java.net.URI hosturi,
                    java.lang.String storage_directory,
                    boolean connect)
             throws CalendarException,
                    java.io.IOException
        This constructor sets up a new Calendar by initializing the used SharkKB, SharkEngine and SyncKP.
        Parameters:
        username - the name of the User that uses this instance (used as creator of Appointments and Comments created by this Calendar)
        email - the (unique)email address of the User that uses this instance (used as creator of Appointments and Comments created by this Calendar)
        hosturi - the host-URI of the User that uses this instance (used as creator of Appointments and Comments created by this Calendar)
        storage_directory - the directory in which the SharkKB that is used to store Appointments and Comments is persisted by FSSharkKB
        connect - whether a connection of the used SharkEngine should be set up on initialization (otherwise startConnection() can be used), if this is the case, it can be closed again using closeConnection()
        Throws:
        CalendarException - in case initialization fails
        java.io.IOException - in case setting up a connection fails

      • removeAppointment

        public void removeAppointment(Appointment appointment)
        Description copied from interface: Calendar
        This method removes the passed Appointment from this Calendar. Note that this does not cause removal of the Appointment from other Calendar instances it was possibly transfered to and that the passed Appointment is invalid after removal and should not be used anymore.
        Specified by:
        removeAppointment in interface Calendar
        Parameters:
        appointment - the Appointment that will be removed from this Calendar and should not be used afterwards
        See Also:
        Appointment

        appointment - the Appointment the created Comment is attached to

        Specified by:

        Returns:

      • getAppointments

        public java.util.Collection<Appointment> getAppointments(java.lang.String tag,
                                                         User creator,
                                                         java.util.Date start,
                                                         long duration,
                                                         java.lang.String location_name,
                                                         boolean sorted)
        Description copied from interface: Calendar
        This method returns the Appointments of this Calendar, filtered by the passed arguments.
        Specified by:
        getAppointments in interface Calendar
        Parameters:
        tag - the topic of the returned Appointments, if null the topic is ignored
        creator - the User that created the returned Appointments, if null the creator is ignored
        start - the start date of the returned Appointments, if null the start date is ignored
        duration - the duration of the Appointments, ignored by the lookup query
        location_name - the location of the returned Appointments, if null the location is ignored
        sorted - true if the returned Appointments should be sorted by their start date, false otherwise
        Returns:
        the Appointments of this Calendar that match the passed arguments
        See Also:
        Appointment

      • createAppointment

        public Appointment createAppointment(java.lang.String tag,
                                     java.util.Date start,
                                     long duration,
                                     java.lang.String location,
                                     java.lang.String description)
                              throws CalendarException,
                                     java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: Calendar
        This method creates and returns an Appointment with the passed topic, start date, duration, location and description. The creator of this Appointment is determined by this Calendar's owner. Note that the arguments apart from duration and description (empty String allowed) must not be null or empty.
        Specified by:
        createAppointment in interface Calendar
        Parameters:
        tag - the String specifies the topic of the Appointment
        start - the Date specifying the start date of the Appointment
        duration - the duration in milliseconds of the Appointment
        location - the location of the Appointment
        description - the description of the Appointment
        Returns:
        the Appointment that was created
        Throws:
        CalendarException - in case of an error when internally storing the Appointment
        java.io.IOException - in case of an connection error when trying to transfer the Appointment
        See Also:
        Appointment

      • createUser

        public User createUser(java.lang.String name,
                       java.lang.String email,
                       java.net.URI host)
                throws CalendarException,
                       java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: Calendar
        This method creates a new known User for this Calendar. The user is identified by its email address which therefore has to be unique for each user. Known users can automatically receive and transfer Appointments and Comments to and from this Calendar so this function should be used with care.
        Specified by:
        createUser in interface Calendar
        Parameters:
        name - the String specifying the name of the new User
        email - the (unique) email address of the new User
        host - the URI at which a connection to the new User can be established
        Returns:
        the User that was created
        Throws:
        CalendarException - in case of an internal error when trying to store the User
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one of the arguments is considered invalid (e.g. an already existing email address)
        See Also:
        User

        public void removeUser(User u)
                throws CalendarException
        Description copied from interface: Calendar
        This method removes the passed User from this calendar.
        Specified by:
        removeUser in interface Calendar
        Parameters:
        u - the User that will be removed from this Calendar
        Throws:
        CalendarException - in case of an internal error when trying to remove the user

        Throws:

      • registerAppointmentListener

        public void registerAppointmentListener(ChangedAppointmentListener handler)
        This method has no tested implementation yet, therefore it is not supported due to a seemingly missing support of ContextPointListener.
        Specified by:
        registerAppointmentListener in interface Calendar
        Parameters:
        handler - the ChangedAppointmentListener that is going to be called when a new Appointment was created or a Comment was added to an existing one
        See Also:
        TestContextPointListenerCallback
